ray.rage.scene.generic

Class AbstractGenericFrustum

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.scene.generic.AbstractGenericFrustum
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Camera.Frustum
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericPerspectiveFrustum

    abstract class AbstractGenericFrustum
extends java.lang.Object
implements Camera.Frustum
    An abstract, projection-agnostic, base implementation for a Camera.Frustum.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

      • setAspectRatio

        public void setAspectRatio(float ratio)
        Description copied from interface: Camera.Frustum
        Sets the aspect ratio for the frustum viewport.

        The width to height ratio of a viewport is usually defined as 1.333333 for 4:3 displays or 1.77777 for 16:9 displays. Mathematically, it's ratio = width / height

        Specified by:
        setAspectRatio in interface Camera.Frustum
        Parameters:
        ratio - The width to height ratio.

      • setAutoAspectRatio

        public void setAutoAspectRatio(boolean enabled)
        Description copied from interface: Camera.Frustum
        If set to true, the viewport will automatically recalculate the aspect ratio of this frustum whenever it's resized.

        Set this to true only when this object is in use by a single viewport.

        Specified by:
        setAutoAspectRatio in interface Camera.Frustum
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable automatic recalculation of the aspect ratio. False otherwise.

      • getAutoAspectRatio

        Specified by:
        getAutoAspectRatio in interface Camera.Frustum
        Returns:
        True when automatic recalculation of aspect ratio is enabled. False otherwise.

      • setNearClipDistance

        public void setNearClipDistance(float nearDist)
        Description copied from interface: Camera.Frustum
        Sets the distance to the near clipping plane.

        The view frustum is a pyramid created from the frustum position and the edges of the viewport, but with its top cut off flat. This method sets the distance between the frustum's position and the near end (or top) of that pyramid.

        The position of the near clipping plane is the distance from the frustum's position to the screen on which the world is projected. The frustum's viewport should have the same aspect ratio as the screen viewport it renders into to avoid distortion.

        Specified by:
        setNearClipDistance in interface Camera.Frustum
        Parameters:
        nearDist - The plane's offset from the frustum's position, in world coordinates. This value must be greater than zero and less than the far clipping plane.
        See Also:
        Camera.Frustum.setFarClipDistance(float)

      • getNearClipDistance

        public float getNearClipDistance()
        Description copied from interface: Camera.Frustum
        Gets the value of the frustum's near clipping plane.
        Specified by:
        getNearClipDistance in interface Camera.Frustum
        Returns:
        The distance from this frustum's current position to the near end of its clipping plane.

      • setFarClipDistance

        public void setFarClipDistance(float farDist)
        Description copied from interface: Camera.Frustum
        Sets the distance to the far clipping plane.

        The view frustum is a pyramid created from the frustum position and the edges of the viewport. This method sets the distance for the far end (or base) of that pyramid.

        Be mindful of the values you choose here. Increasing the ratio between the near and far planes lowers the accuracy of the Z-buffer used for depth testing pixels. An observable side-effect of this might be Z-Fighting.

        Specified by:
        setFarClipDistance in interface Camera.Frustum
        Parameters:
        farDist - The plane's offset from the frustum's position, in world coordinates. This value must be greater than the near clipping plane.
        See Also:
        Camera.Frustum.setNearClipDistance(float)

      • getFarClipDistance

        public float getFarClipDistance()
        Description copied from interface: Camera.Frustum
        Gets the value of the frustum's far clipping plane.
        Specified by:
        getFarClipDistance in interface Camera.Frustum
        Returns:
        The distance from this frustum's current position to the far end of its clipping plane.

      • setFieldOfViewY

        public void setFieldOfViewY(Angle angle)
        Description copied from interface: Camera.Frustum
        Sets the vertical field-of-view (FOV) of this frustum.

        The Field Of View (FOV) is the angle made between the frustum's position and the edges of the 'screen' onto which the scene is projected. Typical values are between 45 and 60 degrees.

        The horizontal field of view is calculated from this viewport's dimensions. They will only be the same if the viewport is square.

        Specified by:
        setFieldOfViewY in interface Camera.Frustum
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle of the field of view.

      • getFieldOfViewY

        public Angle getFieldOfViewY()

        Specified by:

        Returns:
